stories.title: The Reservoir of Creation: New Order
stories.theme: God's instant creative work establishing order from chaos and rest on the Sabbath.

stories.title: Eden: The Sovereign's Test & Labor
stories.theme: Man created to rule as 'King in Miniature Heaven,' placed in Eden to keep and cultivate.

stories.title: The Golden Chain Broken: Instant Surety
stories.theme: The Fall introduces death and judgment, yet God immediately provides ransom through Christ's sacrifice.

stories.title: Succession of Falls: Cain's Brand
stories.theme: Cain's rejection demonstrates the necessity of blood atonement and faith in Christ's coming sacrifice.

stories.title: The Longevity of the First Age
stories.theme: Enoch's faith contrasted with the great corruption of the Antediluvians and their worship of Cain.

stories.title: The Great Art Perishes: Noah's Ark
stories.theme: The perversion of God's gifts through self-glorification merits judgment; the arts are lost in the Flood.

stories.title: The Sign of the Bow: Encompassing Love
stories.theme: The rainbow covenant demonstrates God's mercy and Christ's love as the bridge between God and humanity.

stories.title: Accountability & Divine Sovereignty
stories.theme: God's law against murder reveals both human accountability and God's unlimited sovereignty over nations.

stories.title: Babel: Confederacy of Rebellion
stories.theme: Human self-exaltation and the attempt to replace divine precepts with human laws brings judgment.

stories.title: The Call: Separation and Naked Promise
stories.theme: Abraham chosen from idolatry must separate entirely from human influence and rely on God's naked promise.

stories.title: Lot's Choice: Temporal vs. Spiritual Advantage
stories.theme: Lot's selection of temporal advantage over moral environment leads to inevitable spiritual and physical loss.

stories.title: Melchizedek: Christ's Representative
stories.theme: Melchizedek as Christ's representative perpetuates divine law and establishes the legitimacy of tithing.

stories.title: Covenant of Pieces: Delayed Iniquity
stories.theme: God's long-suffering delays the destruction of the Amorites until their iniquity is full, balancing justice with mercy.

stories.title: Hagar: Human Schemes vs. Divine Plan
stories.theme: Ishmael's birth through human scheming contrasts with God's covenant plan marked by circumcision.

stories.title: Hospitality and the Boundary of Mercy
stories.theme: Abraham's intercession demonstrates mercy, yet Sodom passes the point of no return through deliberate rebellion.

stories.title: Lot's Paralysis and Escape
stories.theme: Lot's hesitation and his family's near-destruction illustrate the consequence of choosing moral compromise.

stories.title: The Akedah: Figure of Self-Denial
stories.theme: Isaac as a type of Christ reveals God's self-denial in giving His Son and demands Abraham's complete surrender.

stories.title: Final Rest: Successor Secured
stories.theme: Sarah's death closes the first promise-bearing era; Rebekah secures the covenant's continuance.

stories.title: Esau's Appetite: The Despised Birthright
stories.theme: Esau's indulgence in physical appetite at the expense of eternal privilege illustrates the tragedy of temporal choice.

stories.title: Jacob's Ladder: Bridging the Gulf
stories.theme: Christ as the ladder bridges the gulf created by sin, restoring separated humanity to communion with heaven.

stories.title: Laban's Artifice and Polygamy's Wrong
stories.theme: Jacob's trials through Laban's deception reveal the spiritual perils of polygamy and human entanglement.

stories.title: Peniel: Victory Through Self-Surrender
stories.theme: Jacob's wrestling with God's visitor teaches that spiritual victory requires humiliation and complete self-surrender.

stories.title: Humbled by Wrong: Purification
stories.theme: The Dinah tragedy and its aftermath show Jacob's family must lay off idols and be purified before God renews His covenant.

stories.title: Esau's Climax and Closure
stories.theme: Esau's genealogical genealogy marks the rejected line's finality, emphasizing covenant inheritance through Jacob alone.

stories.title: The Rejection: Joseph as Christ Type
stories.theme: Joseph, rejected by his brethren and sold for a small sum, foreshadows Christ's innocent suffering and exaltation.

stories.title: Integrity Under Siege: Joseph's Fortification
stories.theme: Joseph's early childhood impressions fortified his heart against temptation, demonstrating fixed principles' power.

stories.title: Prison Discipline: Prepared for Exaltation
stories.theme: Hardship in prison prepares Joseph through obedience to govern wisely, teaching that virtue's reward comes through suffering.

stories.title: Elevation: Man in Whom the Spirit of God Is
stories.theme: Pharaoh recognizes in Joseph a man filled with God's Spirit, proving that moral worth transcends social standing.

stories.title: The Test and Preparation for Reconciliation
stories.theme: Joseph's strategic testing of his brothers brings them to confession and repentance through gentle but firm accountability.

stories.title: Reconciliation and Divine Intent
stories.theme: Joseph's revelation to his brothers demonstrates that God's providential care overrides human malice for redemptive purposes.

stories.title: Vayechi: The Enduring Promise
stories.theme: Jacob's final prophecy and blessing secure the covenant's continuation while warning against instability like Reuben's.
